intro: Allocarya minuta, commonly known as the tiny rock cress, is a small flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded pods containing several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
